conbody.p: The session audit CDRs are generated for IMS and Gy (SMS and MMS) calls.
The IMS Session Audit CDRs also contain rating information of the IMS calls. Operators use these CDRs in billing mediation systems for billing processing.

conbody.codeblock: ------------------------------------- CDR length: 280 Release ID | Version ID: 7|2 Data record format | TS number: 1|7 Release identifier extension: 0 Name Tag Data RecordType 0 OCSChargingRecord recordEventType 1 ImsSessionAudit sessionId 1 1-1-70251;00997799999911||2100000007b8401 deviceId 1 D11-70251 ocsHost 1 r_pcef1.diam.originRealm1.com recordEventResult 1 Success recordSequenceNumber 1 0 RecordTimestamp 1 10/12/2018 09:29:47

conbody.p: IMS Audit CDR is generated only when the application preference Include Final Usage In BCR EDRs is set to LAST_DATA_CALL and BCR occurrs.

conbody.p:
The sample CDRs for session clear are provided in this section. The different values for recordEventResult tag for success/failure scenarios for various session are as follows:
Gy/N40 (5G) session: 302 (Success), 303 (failure)
IMS session: 304 (Success), 305 (failure)
Sy session: 306 (Success), 307 (failure)
For a deleted session, 300 in RAR response indicates that no session was found and 301 indicates that the session deletion failed.
For more information about the meaning of these values, refer to for Gy, N40, IMS and for Gy.
The IMS session audit CDRs also contain rating information of the IMS call. This information is generated only if Enable-Single-CDR is configured in the rule.
